experience: You and Jonathon both know Jonathan Cottrell, Scott Kelly, and 13 others

This semester, it has been a pleasure connecting multiple ASU students with real world professionals to learn about career development, entrepreneurship and networking. As a newly appointed campus fellow for GenFKD, my team and I have brought in experts in crowdfunding, customer experience and usability research, and have conducted multiple activities to help students improve their professional abilities. Big shoutout to Mary Kate Cundiff, Frankie McLister, Nomith Murari, and Romonte(Monte') Moore for their incredible work that they have done this semester. Be sure to come out to our final seminar this semester on public speaking and pitching, at 6:30 PM on November 30th in ASU Memorial Union 240!

Had an amazing opportunity to work with two brilliant computer science students, Hadley Griffin and Niharika Jain, on a workshop about web development basics for Barrett, The Honors College students last night. They presented about HTML, CSS and personal websites. Thank you to everyone who came and to Microsoft for providing some give-away items!
With $36 Million In Financing, Scoop Wants To Make Carpooling Mainstream

Excited to welcome two exceptional undergraduates to our growing Business Development & Strategy team at Planetary Resources, Inc. -- congrats Harry Laird and Rebecca Thoss! Know your contributions are going to help make humanity a space-faring species!
AirGarage is the link between homeowners and businesses that have extra parking and drivers looking for affordable and convenient parking.

Oversee and provide insights from student constituents to propose and review enhancements of existing services and development of new services to meet the needs of the growing student population at ASU.

The NASA Space Grant at ASU funds an independent research project for undergraduate students to enable them to contribute to the national science enterprise in a meaningful way. My research is in the Nanoscience Lab at ASU, exploring photochemistry with diamond, a unique semiconducting material. The focus of my independent project is to reduce the effective work function by manipulating substrate materials and properties of the diamond film in order to allow photoemission into aqueous solutions using light in the visible spectrum.
Barrett Fellow, Center for Meteorite Studies

The Center for Meteorite Studies continually pursues new knowledge about the origin of our planetary system through the study of meteorites, in part so that we may understand the pathway to forming habitable worlds. My research deals with classification of meteorites in novel ways and characterization of fusion crusts as a means of understanding formation processes.
TEDxASU is an independently organized TED conference hosted annually by students at ASU to showcase the ideas worth sharing that are emanating from ASU.

Prior positions:Director of Business Development January 2016 - December 2016Staff Member September 2015 - December 2015Arizona Microcredit Initiative is a 501(c)(3) non-profit that empowers underserved entrepreneurs to start or expand businesses through business instruction, consulting services, and microloans.

• Managed 14 staff members daily, lead the coordination of young adult programs which served over 700 participants per week with growing enrollment over all 5 years• Developed, coordinated, and facilitated educational programs and events for young adults which resulted in higher ratings from participants and adult leaders• Conducted the recruitment, hiring, and training of program staff• Instructed classes of 80+  participants on basic skills such as cooking, knot tying, survival, and many others several times per day, six days per week to adults young and old
Globalization and Popular Culture in China

Participated in a three-week study abroad program organized by the Flinn Foundation and the Council on International Educational Exchange. Studied how both urban (Beijing) and rural (Guiyang) environments are being impacted culturally, politically, and socially by the economic changes of this globalized country in the context of China.

recommendations: September 5, 2017, Quintin and Jonathon were students together

Jonathon is the embodiment of entrepreneurial spirit and creative thought. He is always seeking out innovative solutions that would improve overall quality of life. His most recent example of which is AirGarage, a peer-to-peer marketplace with an overarching goal to improve the parking experience. His determined mindset, willingness to learn and desire to give back are consistently evident in his daily pursuits. It was a pleasure getting to know Jonathon during my time at Arizona State University. I am excited to see where his creative thought process and current venture takes him!

Executive Director at Arizona Microcredit Initiative

Jonathon is one of the most creative and entrepreneurial minds I have had the pleasure of meeting thus far in my life. His initiative and outside-the-box thinking when it came to refining our workshop structure and curriculum changed the entire course of the organization. The increase in performance inspired other members of the organization to get more involved and push themselves to make the greatest impact they could. To anyone who has the opportunity to work with Jonathon Barkl--I promise you won't regret it.

Complicated business problems are no match for a consultant of Alex's caliber. Over the last year and a half while I have been the Director of Business Development for AMI, Alex has worked with me closely  as our lead Associate in Consulting. Alex went above and beyond in helping me to entirely restructure our consulting processes, ensuring that we were making the largest impact possible on the entrepreneurs of Phoenix. He always managed to keep our team grounded and focused throughout meetings, maintaining a positive outlook all the while. Alex would be a valuable asset to any company thanks to his knack for consulting and ability to analyze problems in a unique way, and for that he earns my full recommendation.

Director of Operations at Arizona Microcredit Initiative
November 22, 2016, Jonathon worked with Michael in different groups

People like Michael are the key to the success of any organization. I have had the pleasure of knowing Michael for the last year and a half, during which time he was the Director of Operations for AMI and I was the Director of Business Development. Beyond all else, Michael often blew me away with his tact in dealing with delicate situations, as well as his ability to ensure that all of the behind-the-scenes functions of our organization were taken care of. And of course, he even managed to bring a sense of humor to each of our meetings. Michael would be an invaluable asset to any team that requires strong organizational support or management, and I wholeheartedly recommend him.
